Cons: Rude guest , I would have 7 tables at one time and would feel overwhelm. My first week without my trainer i got 4 tables at once. Co-workers would let your guest food just sit there while you busy.

Title: "A learning experience"
Pros: Met life long friends, learned the basics of customer service
Cons: no benefits, but like that of any serving job
Advice to Management: remember it's not a career for most people, it's usually a means of drinking money during college, so make it fun to work there!

Title: "Excellent!"
Pros: Very good sand box for restaurants. Makes money! Good environment!
Cons: All the problems are good ones and can be fixed.

Title: "Rewarding and frustrating at the same time"
Pros: The possibility to make money is there. Compensation is better than a lot of other places in the area.
Cons: The hours can be long and the store is open later than business really dictates.

Title: "Good high school job"
Pros: Opportunity to make great money for a high school job. Provides a great environment to develop customer service and communication abilities.
Cons: Hours can be unpredictable. Business can be undpredictable as well, meaning you might be stuck there when it isn't very busy, and you will be doing a fair amount of work for little to know money in a given shift.
Advice to Management: Carefully select your store managers and don't be afraid to let them go. I worked with several lazy managers. To be a good leader, you must first be a good servant.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible schedules and somewhat good tips.
Cons: Working around holidays. Certain months will stay slow (around time for school, Derby, Christmas). Getting wows which are customer comments/feedback on the Applebees website.
Advice to Management: Hire less shady people. Support your store management teams. The District Manager is terrible at management, he acts like a dictator instead of a team leader. This effects everyone down to the servers because the restaurant managers are incapable of doing their job to the best of their ability due to the DM bureaucracy.

Title: "A job for beginners in the industry"
Pros: Room for growth within the company. They don't judge you based on tattoos.
Cons: Management was unprofessional. I know they have gone through a lot of changes in the past few years but when I worked there it was a joke.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Fun people and a fun environment. Good job if you are young, but not something that you want to try and do with a family. Especially if you have young children.
Cons: bad pay, bonus were promised that weren't received. Owner added things to our P&L that shouldn't have been and it affected our bottom line.
Advice to Management: Go somewhere else, they pay better. The owners only cared about their bottom line, and shorted us out of the bonuses that we had earned.

Title: "Great place to start"
Pros: It is the easiest out of most restaurants to train and advance. It will teach you to deal with all types of people.
Cons: Tips will not always be great. Sometimes downright disappointing

Title: "Stressful for backoffice the house staff"
Pros: Fast Paced environment, company opening new locations, meet new friends and opportunity to work at additional locations for more experience. Free food
Cons:
More stress than is necessary when there is a business night and you are the lowest paid department making the most important items for guests.
Servers complaining about the speed of food as guest are complaining to them.
Physically impossible demands on plates, Steaks can't be cooked in 5 mins unless the microwave is used, which i have seen it happen.
Advice to Management: keep up the great work, stocks prices are rising so i'm sure the bank is full.

Title: "Waitress/Server"
Pros: They are very good at working with your schedule.
Cons: If guests do not come in, you do not make money.

Title: "Meh"
Pros: Great coworkers and great management...
Cons: Start out as a host, don't get a lot of chances to move up...

Title: "Worst job ever"
Pros: I made decent money and stayed off of welfare as a single mom. The hours were flexible and I met some good people.
Cons: I learned that most people lack basic communication skills, whether it's a co-worker, mgmt., or clientele. Mgmt., was in constant chaos due to the psychological harassment/abuse inflicted on them by their higher ups. As a staff, our shifts and sections were constantly threatened by our amount of sales and up sells, when half of the time people complained about their food and got discounts; making it impossible to stay consistent in the top percent. At the first applebee's I worked at, they cut our shifts if we started to make too much money. The franchise office lost my paperwork and lied by saying that they never received it when they had in fact made the confirmation that they had. A lot of the people who work there don't grow past the emotional maturity of 18, but I think that's a lot of people in any job. The clientele has made me lose faith in humanity.
Advice to Management: If your staff fears you, they don't actually respect you. Being spiteful and cruel is petty, and this is why you're not happy. Upper management is delusional, and if you don't learn how to treat people the right way, your business will eventually fail.

Title: "Good job depending on if your work for a corporate or franchise store and which franchise."
Pros: Make great money for what it is.
Cons: Work lots of long shifts.
Advice to Management: Get paid what you want not what they offer.

Title: "family like work enviroment"
Pros: Was a great company to work for everyone was like family!
Cons: long shifts at times majority of the money made is made by tips
Advice to Management: all new management has been assigned not sure at this point what it is going to be like.

Title: "Applebee's - Lewisville, TX."
Pros: Easy, easy, easy. This job is very simple and requires minimal brain function if you have an average IQ or above.
Cons:
Most people that work here don't have an average IQ or above. It seems that common sense has been burned out of brains by over-active-Facebook logins and "work ethic" is thing of the past. There is very little pride that is kept amongst the staff and all are clocked in just to make a quick buck with the least amount of work possible. Because of this, tables aren't cleaned properly, floors aren't kept swept, the back of house is a Petrie dish for who-knows what, and the expo line items are rarely rotated and almost always just topped-off with new product.

Now, on to our fearless leaders. The management turnover at this restaurant is ridiculous. In the last two years, this store has seen 4 General Managers, 3 Area Directors, at least a dozen salaried managers, and (Applebee's new trick for saving money) multiple key-hourly managers. Let's start with the key hourly managers first, since they really are the least influential to this company (Or the greatest, according to them). These "managers" are really glorified card holders that can do table visits and discounts. However, they also think that they are entitled to write employees up, instate new store policies, and treat employees as though they are beneath them. Again, you are glorified card holders, that is all.

Next, we have the salaried managers. There's a spastic, disrespectful General manager whose newly coveted position has all wondering what he will be able to do for this store...if anything...there's the Kitchen Manager who's frequent trips away from the store always lead him to return to the store with what can only be assumed to be a vodka-induced buzz, and the Front of House Manager might possibly have the lowest IQ known to man. Seriously.

This franchised store is one of about 35 owned by the same company. These stores have been run into the ground, been forced to run on skeleton crews, and tabletops have been turned into toilet bowls filled with marketing vomit. The focus on providing great customer service has gone away. The owner truly only cares about the bottom line, and it is starting to show.
Advice to Management: The Director of Operations should clean house with the management staff and start over completely fresh.

Title: "Fun place to work"
Pros: fun atmosphere and the tips are good.The management is usually pretty easy to get along with. Coworkers are always willing to help and the schedule is very flexible.
Cons: The insurance benefits offered by the company were minimal. They were basically a discount program. Advancement was available if you know the right person and there is alot of gossip.
Advice to Management: Recognize good employees by offering pay raises, even if they are a server.

Title: "Great place to start with no experience"
Pros: Flexible schedule. Learn how to serve and "up sell". Lot of fun and made great friends and relationships that will last a lifetime. Used to be a great atmosphere. Cash in hand every night.
Cons: Have to work nights and weekends. Management plays favorites. Attracts lower end clientele. Management made promises they couldn't keep. Cheap food for cheap people. Fire senior cooks to bring in new cooks at a lower cost.
Advice to Management: Keep your word and promote your long term employees.

Title: "nothing crazy"
Pros: at least you get free food
Cons: have to stand on your feet all day

Title: "Work hard"
Pros: Hard work, management is funky
Cons: Don't like prep work, bad shifts
Advice to Management: Talk to your employees more

Title: "Great place"
Pros: Flexible scheduling, friendly management, good money
Cons: Lack of growth opportunities, difficult customers
Advice to Management: Provide a path to management

Title: "Hard work, good pay, good people"
Pros: Fun, gets better with experience, fast paced
Cons: Busy, constant menu changes, hard to advance to management
Advice to Management: Hire from within

Title: "Overall its an okay place to work if you're just starting out in the restaurant industry."
Pros: Coworkers are great. Free meal if you work in the BOH.
Cons: Management can be a little disorganized. The hours aren't too great.

Title: "Applebee's is one of the best jobs I have had."
Pros:
Working for this company was one of the best choices I had made. They are fair and time off is promised and given.
There's always room to grow with this company if you want it and work for it.
Cons: I really have no cons with this company. This company makes you feel welcomed and just a great place to work.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work guys you make your employees feel great to come to work , it's a place you want to come to work .

Title: "this is my review"
Pros: well there are lots of things to do. its great
Cons: well sometimes theres to much to do. its not great.

Title: "horrible"
Pros: no pros at all for this gong show
Cons: treated horrible, know one cares about you.
Advice to Management: just quit you guys are to worried about paper work then employees and food cooking

Title: "Positive environtment"
Pros: Money to be made, training is great, customer service roles
Cons: managers are not the best at their jobs, more hours

Title: "Good temporary part time job."
Pros: Work with cool people, decent tips, nice atmosphere.
Cons: Lower end restauraunt meaning (quite often but not always) customers come to stretch a penny, resulting in low tips.

Title: "Do not work for the Bee's."
Pros: Your co-workers, including most of the management.
Cons: Everything else! I seriously mean everything. AppleBee's started following the ObamaCare rules an entire year early. If you are an hourly employee YOU WILL NOT get a yearly vacation. They raised their requirements to receive a vacation from 32hrs a week on average to 38hrs a week in order to receive your vacation BUT, due to the ObamaCare restrictions, you will not get more then 30hrs a week. AppleBee's gives you nothing in return for hard work to make them more money and they keep making changes to make it harder for you to do even that. I could go on for quite awhile about how terrible this company is and their entirely unfair treatment of their employees but, I'll just leave it at this... Do NOT work for the Bee's!
Advice to Management: Not so much advice to the management as to corporate... Come work my job for a month or even a week and lets see if your policies don't change. My bet is... They would in a heartbeat if you had to work by these policies, rules and, regulations as we do!

Title: "Working for Applebee's is like being on a rollercoaster. One day you learning and moving ahead, the next you are forgot."
Pros: Bonuses and marketing support are strong. Systems and structure are extremely evident.
Cons: Schedule leaves little room for quality of life. Have turned to a policy of advancing young and inexperienced staff because they simply do not enough to question policy and procedure and therefore will never have a opportunity to improve them.
Advice to Management: Upper management needs to realize who actually does what. Advancement opportunities are given to those who simply say what management wants to hear. Having no real knowledge of the position they are being handed not only sets them up for failure but also creates a negative impact on the business.

Title: "Good place to work part time"
Pros: Flexible hours, friendly staff, discounts on food and stuff, awesome manager. Sometimes customers tip really big and thats awesome. Cool logo.
Cons: Most customers are rude or children or don't tip. Wage is low so you have to work hard to get good tips. Always busy and it's hard work.
Advice to Management: Some staff can be unreliable and rude. Make sure that your team can cooperate under stress.

Title: "Decent work"
Pros: Work around my school obligations. Easy work. Attire is comfortable. Everyone is pretty nice, but like every other job, it has its fair share of drama.
Cons: Lots of turn over. Not many hours for anyone. Customers can be rude as with anywhere else. Not much room for growth within the store.

Title: "TSFR Applebee's Franchise"
Pros: Salary was good for the industry. Worked many years for a great Area director. Until regions were switched.
Cons: Leadership team that lacks the understanding to run sit down restaurants, squeezing profit out of the buildings at the expense of guest service, unrealistic budgets, creates core values (employer of choice) yet has no meaningful action to make this reality, HR is biased and associates with staff outside of business, constant changes to leadership, leadership came from another restaurant and has moved most original staff out to hire friends from last restaurant franchise (TGIF), high accountability with no support, concerned with looking good instead of being good. (Don't work for TSFR AppleVenture).
Advice to Management: Actually know what you are buying. Casual dinning is not fast food. Get some accountants who can get P&L out on time, and can properly run payroll. Stop being smug, you are not better than anyone else. You really should also be more professional. When a manager was terminated the whole company knew and knew why (Luddington). Move all leadership team out and start over. They are terrible.

Title: "host"
Pros: tips, cowokers, flexible hours, food,
Cons: late hours, rude customers, low hourly pay

Title: "Good money as a bartender"
Pros: Benefits, pay raises if you work hard. Good training program. Consistent schedule.
Cons: High rotation of management. Challenging clientele.

Title: "Operated by employee's not manager's"
Pros: Make decent money and easy to do.
Cons: Poorly run, lack of accountability, and focus
Advice to Management: Need to clean house of unprofessionalism and really see what's going on

Title: "Fun job, yet upper management issues pervade the company"
Pros: Nice employees, mid level management is superb and encouraging. Decent pay.
Cons: No real training guidelines, they kind of just throw you out there. The upper management was horrid, created an awful hostile workplace focused on goals not necessarily related to any important facets of the business. My general manager was disrespectful towards employees regularly and harbored a very bad temper. The management above him were not personable, and very discouraging - often during visits to the locations they would not even acknowledge you - for example, I once said a simple "hi how are you" to one of the area directors, and he simply ignored me and walked away after clearly hearing me, how is that for professional at all..? Also, when it came to compensation, often the managers would do everything in their power in order to cut wages of the hourly employees, and did not offer much respect to them in that aspect. I also tried to reach their HR department to report hostile actions by one of the managers, and I was blatantly ignored. There is no real organization in this company, whether it be in making sure an employee knows what they are doing, or installing any type of procedure in which to handle a given issue - as most often you were expected to "wing it"
Advice to Management: I would advise that you focus on goals relevant towards the restaurant business such as increasing your customer base and offering them better service, as well as creating proper training procedures. Also - make management a more encouraging body, as currently they are what kept me away from keeping my job.

Title: "Assistant Manager"
Pros: Well known company looks good on resume, good systems, good training, decent pay,
Cons: For an Assistant Manager there is no connection to the rest of the company, and company leaders don't "waste" their time with you, which made me feel very unappreciated. This feeling of inconsideration seemed to trickle down to the staff as well.
Advice to Management: Great place to get experience and learn. Not the type of place I would like to stay at forever, but you can move up relatively quickly compared to many other corporations

Title: "I worked here for way longer than expected"
Pros: Pretty good staff, fun, decent money
Cons: Management can be a pain depending on who, and they change constantly.

Title: "Great vision, poor execution"
Pros: The company has a gold card value system that really does create a potential for a great environment. It is obvious that there are great minds at work in striving to stay competitive with menu trends and technology. The salary benefits are also competitive and attractive.
Cons: Lack of focus and accountability on an operational corporate level. Hourly staff is overworked and underpaid.
Advice to Management: Micro-manage less. Give stores financial goals and allow them to develop their own system for achieving this.

Title: "I have been with this company for seven years. Loved my time here. Just time for a change."
Pros: Great atmosphere, great co-workers, family style.
Cons: Can be stressful, but mostly fun!, but what you put in, you don't necessarily get back.
Advice to Management: Maybe general management could take a little more time to get to know there staff, instead of playing "favorites", It can hurt feelings.

Title: "Great starter server job. Very happy with my time there."
Pros: Being a part time server at Applebee's was my food service job and it was great for a college student. My managers were great, made good friendships with my coworkers, the food was good, the managers really backed up the employees as well as put customer service first. With tips I usually ended up making $10+ per hour, unless the restaurant was particularly slow, up to $20 on crazy busy nights. The train you well to be a good server. It's pretty easy to switch out a shift or get time off.
Cons: You'll get grumpy customers, slow nights at times. Sometimes you get slammed and have to really think on your feet and prioritize a dozen things that you have to do. It can be stressful and you get off really late at night. Applebee's gives out lots of coupons, deals, and stuff that brings in cheap people! People can get half their meal off if they strategize it and that can bring your tips down a lot.
Advice to Management: As a server, there wasn't really a way to 'move up' in the company. That kind of comes with a food service position that usually caters to high school and college students etc. but at the same time, it made me leave the company and move to a better restaurant in order to 'move up'.

Title: "Server Miami, work felt like high school again"
Pros: Customers were usually very happy, and easy to please, Easy job for young college students.
Cons: As a new server there, i had some new managers training in my establishment, who would hassle me and others constantly and tell me how to do my job, as if I had never worked a job before, good thing it was a in-between gig for me. I'd hate to see the restaurants they ended up managing, overall it made the experience worrying for me about the future of this place, because I really like this place as a customer.
Advice to Management: My actual manager was really good, we had the best sales in the whole region, keep up the good work, but i think the managers themselves might need more training, or a better approach to dealing with workers, personally i felt downgraded like i was a kid, im 25 and was the oldest worker there.

Title: "Had A Fun Time There"
Pros: I worked with alot of fun people so that made it an enjoyable work atmosphere. It was always busy so the work shifts went by fast.
Cons: As in any type of job working directly with the public, you see both the good as well as bad side of people.

Title: "Fun work atmosphere terrible management"
Pros: Flexible hours with lots of opportunity to cross train on other positions. Shifts are often fun, but can be stressful due to fast paced environment which is par for the course in any service industry job .
Cons: Favoritism is a huge problem with in this company. Promotions and raises are based on who you are dating or friends with. I was there 3 years and got one $.25 raise. While the "men" in similar positions were given raises repeatedly and promoted constantly. One of the biggest problems with in this company is gender equality. The prettiest females were trained on bar regardless of their ability; average girls were trained on serving; plain girls were made hostesses. One girl was told that she was too fat to be a bartender and another was told she was not pretty enough. Another employee was blind in one eye and was told she could not be a server because her eye would upset the guests. I had to fight for a year to get moved to serving but only had to ask once to be moved into the kitchen. Then the struggle started over again; I wanted to cook seeing as I have a Culinary certification. I was put on prep and expo for another year and had to beg and plead and compromised for a loss of hours in exchange for training on fry station. Male employees were cross trained on all kitchen stations without having to ask. The turnover rate for this company is outrageous both for general employees and management. In my 3 years of employment I had 4 dining room managers and 7 kitchen managers.
Advice to Management: Treat all employees equally regardless of who they know or what they look like. Continuing this work ethic is bound to end in a lawsuit.

Title: "Plan B or Last Resort"
Pros:
You will meet people you will never forget and probably never want to lose touch with.
Good opportunity to learn the ropes of a high paced serving atmosphere.
flexible hours and if you need an extra 20$ for gas, shift pickups are always available
Cons:
I've worked 12-14 hours and only made 100-110$
Some co-workers do not pull there own weight.
Some may get away with things you may not get away with (ex: getting cut early)
Summer time-18-21 servers per shift
Winter time-14-16 servers per shift
Eventually- you will learn that are just not making the money you deserve.
Advice to Management: We need to be paid more hourly OR something needs to be done with how we are tipped. 7$ on 120$ bill with 3% tip pout is UNACCEPTABLE

Title: "Ripped off for my tips"
Pros: Co workers, tips, atmosphere, flexible,
Cons: Greedy management, hourly pay is low,
Advice to Management: Don't suck

Title: "Applebee's - We haven't figured out who we are in this industry."
Pros: Flexibility, good quality of life. Cant really think of too many other good things about this job.
Cons: Not a People first company. Culture is non existent. Leadership is a joke.
Advice to Management: Get real. Learn how to lead people.

Title: "Good place to work for while in college and need a flexible schedule but no long term career options available."
Pros: Schedule can be flexible to meet your needs while still making enough money to pay your bills and go out from time to time.
Cons: Management is not great. Employees know more than the management team does.
Advice to Management: Do more training and learn the restaurant industry from the ground up.

Title: "The Neighborhood"
Pros: Great people to work with and great atmosphere
Cons: long hours could have higher pay

Title: "Great place to work during college"
Pros: Flexible schedule, good money, good management,
Cons: Clientele, expensive insurance, back of house staff

Title: "very thought out routine"
Pros: Team support great new tasty foods plus drinks , very clean
Cons: Sharp corners blind side , no trays, computer diaolog abrv.
Advice to Management: Get drinking server tray

Title: "Great place to chill and do nothing"
Pros: Great team! Scheduling is a plus. A nice place to work if you dont want to be over controlled by managers.
Cons: You will be stuck working all the holidays. Too corporate! Always pushing to sell one thing or another.

Title: "Worst job I've ever had.."
Pros: 1.) Some of the other employees are really nice and are now like family
Cons:
1.) The general manager continuously makes our jobs m. e difficult by micromanaging
2.) Upper management frequently clocks employees out without telling them and continue to let them work. Sometimes 10,30, even 45 minutes.
3.) I've been repeatedly verbally abused as a host by half the servers. They've gone so far as to throw items at me for seating too many people of a certain race in their section. Ive been sexually harassed by my key hourly. Everyday at least 3 people get so stressed by the guests, management, and fellow employees that they have to walk away and cry. I have never been more stressed out by a job. Since my first week there Ive started suffering from severe headaches and tension in my jaw caused by grinding my teeth in my sleep, not to mention stomach upset from the stress. I dread going to work so much that I've started having panic attacks before my Saturday night shift. I want to quit but we mostly have local businesses in my area that are too broke to hire anyone. So Applebee's is one of the few employers around.
4.) Frequently denied breaks. Policy says (or at least my managers do, but who knows) if you work 10 hours that you are entitled to a 30 minute lunch period. However the majority of the employees have worked 10-12 hours straight and were only allowed maybe one 5 min cigarette break, if that.
5.) The pay is terrible, especially considering everything you have to put up with. I currently make 7.25/hr
6.) Hard work is rarely appreciated
7.) Having worked in customer service for several years, i can honestly say ive never been so severely disrespected by customers until I started working here

Title: "Dangerous"
Pros: A very dangerous place to work and eat. Applebees has no policies to restrain thug customers who mistreat employees of a different race. Applebees is sobent on making that dollar that the safty of their employees comes after profits.
Cons: Upper management is aware of the problem, but refuses to acknowledge the danger. They are so against any guest filing a complaint that they expect their employees to put up with any misstreatment and harrassment, and believe me Applebees attracts the worst ratchets in Meridian. Applebees has trained their guests to complain about the food or service and they will get their meal free. They also know that if they lodge a complaint with the corporation, they will recieve more coupons for free food and the thug croud will go to any lengths for something free.
Advice to Management: Set policies to attract a noticeably better croud and put employee safety ahead of pleasing a guest whose intent is to racially mistreat an employee. By far the most immoral place of employment i have ever worked

Title: "Demoralizing"
Pros: This atmosphere is casual, laid-back, and management seemed to work with me on my availability. The staff I worked with was amazing. We are still friends to this day.
Cons: The clientele is awful. The "class" of people who walk in that restaurant are just as disgusting as the food. The clientele, for the most part, can be described as ratchet, low-income, and undignified.
Advice to Management: The money can't be that great - go find a career. I feel as though the managers get stuck in these restaurants. I feel as though they have set goals for themselves and Applebee's prevents them from achieving that goal.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great new menu items! There's nothing good about working here other than my co workers.
Cons:
*Constant nagging and criticism from managers no matter how hard I work.*
*working 4pm-3am with no break and managers get frustrated when asked for a break*
*Most customers are rude and after half price happy hour starts , the clientele worsens and the job becomes even more stressful , I've had too many walk outs and had to pay the bill myself."
*Cooks are lazy and slow."
*Managers are always pointing out what we're doing wrong .*
* I have watched a co worker have a panic attack because of the level of stress working here.*
*Managers will give you fewer hours after judging you.*

Title: "Server Job"
Pros: making friends was quite easy
Cons: Only pay $4 and tips wasn't adding up
Advice to Management: something needs to change

Title: "Server"
Pros: You get what you put in when talking about tips. Hard to fail at this job if you know what you are doing.
Cons: You have to be the manager occasionally
Advice to Management: Keep the staff positive

Title: "Bartender"
Pros: Applebees is honestly a great company to work for. Great atmosphere, easy going yet professional work environment. They have great employees and its refreshing to work with such a great group of people
Cons: There are not too many chances for advancement, and as a bartender the pay should be more than 4 something an hour. Day bartending shifts are terrible, but you can sell a good amount during games at night and on weekends

Title: "Applebee's was a good place to work."
Pros: Meet people from many different walks of life.
Cons: Long hours. Late nights.

Title: "Good Place to Work"
Pros: Benefits, work-life balance and PTO are all great.
Cons: The structure is very flat, so there's not much opportunity for professional development or growth within the organization.
Advice to Management: Consider restructuring so there's more opportunities for growth and development of people who've been there a long time or desire to grow with the company.

Title: "It has been a very pleasant experience, and the restaurant (at least the one I work at) has a great work environment."
Pros: Pretty good tips, easy work if you have a good memory and do not mind hustling.
Cons: Co-workers can get edgy if they are not good with busy work.
Advice to Management: Always make sure you stay positive. The rest of the staff is feeding off of whatever energy you throw out. Positivity and friendliness to employees goes incredibly far.

Title: "Co-workers and management are awesome. Upper management have no concept of how a restaurant operates."
Pros: Sometimes people do not leave bad tips.
Cons: Company does not care about employees. Company is cheap.
Advice to Management: Find a better job.

Title: "It's what you make of it"
Pros: You decide your own salary depending on how well you do. Co-workers are great and for the most part so are the guests with the occasional bad table
Cons: Can't work full time. Inconsistent pay, rude guests. There are long hours and no breaks allowed. No benefits or paid time off either.

Title: "OK job but very stressful."
Pros: Got to meet a lot of good people
Cons: Very stressful. No life outside of work.

Title: "Great Place"
Pros: Great work company to work for. You cannot go wrong with Applebee's.
Cons: None, just make sure you negociate your salary.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Fast paced work environment that makes you think quickly and make decisions even quicker."
Pros:
Decent money for the area.
Flexible hours.
Cons:
Conflicting goals and resources to achieve said goals.
Lack of enthusiasm by some leaders.
Can be stretched thin at times.
Advice to Management: Keep every manager accountable, that will flow down to the employees.

Title: "Lackluster place of employment"
Pros:
-fun place to work
-Good hours for those of us who enjoy the nightlife
Cons:
-Pretty much everything else.
-Boring training videos
-forced to work holidays
-bad cliential
-microwaved atmosphere

Title: "Too corporate"
Pros: Fast money, great co-workers, online scheduling, clean
Cons: Too much focus on pushing certain menu items, food unoriginal

Title: "Not the worst job, but far from good""
Pros: The hours are flexible for the most part
Cons:
Work every single holiday, even the little ones
Extremely unprofessional, the managers can get away with murder
Favoritism is a real and serious threat
If you don't hit it off with the crew and managers, you wont get the good shifts (nights and weekends) and it wont be worth your time
Customers will be terrible to you, it's in the job description as a server/host
Advice to Management: Set some standards for yourself, respect your employees more, and take some pride in what you do

Title: "Subpar working environment"
Pros: Bonuses and wage raises are given if your work performance is excellent. Promotions to management are available to those that have been cross trained in every aspect of the restaurant. Flexible scheduling for those needing school or religious exceptions.
Cons: Lack of quality leadership traits in management. No professional boundaries. Communication issues are a big issue as well as etiquette.(Rude aberrant behavior on the part of some managers even the GM) Tips are taken out of your pay check.
Advice to Management: Have a behavioral etiquette class on how to speak to and approach employees in different situations. Learn to set professional boundaries.

Title: "I felt completely unappreciated and taken advantage of."
Pros: Its a laid back environment, you get opportunities to socialize often and my co-workers were hilarious.
Cons: Some of the supervisors had a complete lack of regard for the employees feelings or obligations (i.e. your children). You could be put in a compromising position, basically choosing between your job or taking care of your children at any time, at a moments notice. Rarely were you acknowledged for your achievements, which provided you no motivation to want to go the extra mile. If you were sick, like physically sick they had no problem with you running to the bathroom to vomit between taking an order and putting it into the POS system.
Advice to Management: Be a little more considerate, flexible and understanding. If a person considers themselves to be a hard worker and proves it to be so acknowledge that every once and a while. If someone is so sick you can see it on their face, consider this; what guests to be served by someone who looks like they could vomit at any time?

Title: "How i spent my earlier years at Applebees Restaurant."
Pros: There is a work friendly environment..employees and managers make u feel at home..
Cons: This company does not offer any benefits to its employees....the pay is not sufficient as it is minimum wage...
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work

Title: "the ability to lead and inspire individuals to a higher level of excellence and execution to create Brand Loyalty throug"
Pros: Great opportunity to learn a major chain.
Cons: The compensation package could be better.
Advice to Management: NA

Title: "Great company to work for! Worked well with personal schedules and great to their employees."
Pros: Good work environment, great customers, good chain of commands.
Cons: Some shifts have long hours.

Title: "Character building"
Pros: You get tipped as a hostess even, and pretty ok ones at that. It's always busy, so that can be good or bad, depending on your view.
Cons: You are a vessel for food, but also expected to be perfect, charming, all-knowing and patient. You will be treated horribly by one-time, passing through customers and creeped on by regulars. Get good at acting.
Advice to Management: FIRE people who don't do their job. Don't keep them around ruining everyone else's job.

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: Pay was decent, The Restaurant was clean.
Cons:
No Work Life Balance. The Franchise Group I worked for expected you to work until. your time wasn't important. The Manager Managed by Intimidation every other word to employee;s was :you will be fired " "I will fire you" "I haven't Fired any one lately" " Do you want to get fired" Very Negative Environment.
Yelling and Screaming at employee's was common place. The Manager that doesn't subscribe to this antiquated view of people management is seen as weak. all of the above of course will be denied but trust me this is a real world first hand view. Worst mistake I every made working for this company. You will get the real picture after you come out of training. Training well it's not as good as they believe it is there are programs that head and shoulder above what they offer.
Advice to Management: Focus on people strength's work on Building consensus and a team environment that's positive, maybe you will be able to get more productivity from you people.

Title: "Just another good tip job (if you did your job very well)."
Pros: It was close to home, I made adequate tips and I got as many hours as I wanted.
Cons: A great many of the employees were lazt, management included.
Advice to Management: Learn the job that your subordinates have to perform.

Title: "Nothing special, serving job."
Pros: Applebee's is very fast pace and has a very broad guest base. It is almost always busy enough to be worth your time. Many of the managers truly care about their jobs and their employees. Daytime guests tend to be the older retired crowd which can be very fun.
Cons: It seems like the place never closes which means you can work all hours of the night and then be back to work at 9:00 the next day. Also the late night happy hour can bring in some very difficult guests who expect a lot of work on a very low check average. Elderly get a discount so expect 10% of your sales to be compensated back to the guest.
Advice to Management: Labor is a big deal but it should't cut into proper employee training, poor training leads to high turn over.

Title: "It will be fun but its terrible"
Pros: It is a great environement with great people, the managment is terrible and the food is even worse.
Cons: THe managers. The food the cooks, ther servers, everyone it was the worst.

Title: "Applebee's was great with the first round of management"
Pros:
It was a great company and great management with great employees, kitchen, front of the house and carside.
The the company was bought out by another franchise. BOOM! !!!!!
Cons: It became microwave haven, rude new management. BESIDES a few! !. No employee was good enough anymore. The higher ups became hateful and rude. Witch made a place where every employee was there from the beginning to lot's of new faces. Dress codes didn't matter. We didn't matter.!!! I felt bad for all those great manager's and the fantastic employees. If you love microwave food and server's that are stressed about loosing their jobs go to the BEE'S.
Advice to Management: Be FAIR, be nice, TREAT HOW YOU WANT TO BE TREATED. Be a HUMAN. To those great manager's GET OUT! !!

Title: "A great company that promotes within"
Pros: Fun and enjoyable work experience. great employees that take pride in their job. I would recommend anyone that wants to advance in the company
Cons: Small salaries and hard to reach bonuses. Long hours are a must and if you have a family don't plan on spending any time with them
Advice to Management: Management works hard, reward them with higher pay or annual pay increases

Title: "Server"
Pros: Free food but very greasy
Cons: Working weekends and holidays was hard
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Great people, horrible work"
Pros: Great people to work with, fun enviroment
Cons: Poor management, long hours, drama
Advice to Management: be more effective

Title: "Negative experience overall."
Pros: Great people to work with, management was lacking, however.
Cons: Management did not seem to care much about employees. More concerned with pulling rank and during civil discussions about workplace improvement than improving the workplace at all.
Advice to Management: Some managers needed much better leadership qualities.

Title: "Very interesting experience"
Pros:
Not too many customers
Very laid back
Tip out
Cons: We do things that they should hire buss boys to do, but i guess that why we get 3% of the resturant earnings that night
Advice to Management: Try to keep the schedule clear

Title: "Fun and light environment"
Pros: Very team oriented, everyone gets along well
Cons: Hard to get a good schedule (many shifts) a first

Title: "Trying at times"
Pros: fast paced, some career opportunity's but you have to be in the right crowd.
Cons: bonus structure is crazy and makes no since what so ever and no matter how close you get they get you some how.

Title: "Fun work environment, valuable transferrable skills"
Pros: Fun and upbeat work atmosphere. Worked here part-time throughout undergraduate and made $25K year in tips as a full-time student, but enjoyed enough flexibility in scheduling for variance in availability semester to semester and travel time.
Cons: Some seemingly futile corporate policies and cheesy promotions, late hours, lack of guaranteed pay from shift-to-shift and no benefits due to serving salary. Would recommend to students and entry level professionals seeking supplementary weekend income, but not a feasible career unless promoted to management.

Title: "Forward thinking, fun company to work for that cares about its people and guests."
Pros: Growth opportunities within the company and across the U.S., development programs to assist with your career, fair pay, state of the art systems, reputation as a giant in casual dining, work alongside great people.
Cons: The restaurant industry commands 55 hours per week in management and since weekends are the busiest shifts most managers work one or two days each weekend. It can be a high stress situation as business dictates. Need to be able to handle all types of situations.
Advice to Management: While new systems help with understanding the casual dining industry, they also can take the teams away from the prime directive of serving great food and being involved with the guest. Do more analysis on the QOL piece and retention / turnover will save millions.

Title: "It was fun"
Pros: fun people, and really good food.
Cons: your feet will be in pain.

Title: "Good place to work while in school."
Pros: I worked in almost all FOH positions and genuinely enjoyed it most of the time. The scheduling was flexible enough that I could work around school, another job and internships.
Cons: Management could be inconsistent in expectations. When things went wrong there was no constructive criticism given, it was either harsh words or nothing at all.
Advice to Management: Focus on the performance of all of your employees when giving shifts, incentives, and praise rather than your personal opinions of them. Constructive criticism is really important in creating a successful work environment.

Title: "Good first job."
Pros: Flexible scheduling, discount on food, fun co-workers
Cons: Late hours, restaurant closes at 1 am so you can be there until 2 am
Advice to Management: Add an automatic gratutity

Title: "Informal"
Pros: Steady job. Pay is not great. Training is very poor. Overworked Asst. Manager.
Cons: Manager doesn't care about employees.
Advice to Management: Better training program.

Title: "good job, but a lot of turnover"
Pros:
-Flexible schedule
-great chance at making a lot of cash
-heavily discounted food
- great management team
- easy work
-incredibly friendly staff
Cons:
-If it's slow, the money is bad
- No vacation for part time workers
- Expected to do work outside of what is in your job description
- Pressured to accept shifts on days you have off
- High turnover due to the business
- No sitting at all, even if you have worked for over 10 hours

Title: "Starting salary at my franchise lower than most but bonus is better than most also."
Pros: Good benefits, Advancement opportunities.
Cons: Long hours, quality of life depends on franchise owners.
Advice to Management: It's not just about the bottom line. Humans can only do so much.

Title: "Decent money, laid back work environment"
Pros:
-Tips
-Fun
-Relatively laid back environment (Not strict or overly stressful)
Cons: -Customers are rude and some tip poorly (Or not at all)

Title: "Do Not Work Here"
Pros: Some of the staff keeps a positive attitude in very difficult situations with the management.
Cons: The culture is horrible. Little or no training. Tenured employees have no patience or desire to train new staff. Upper management cares little about employee advancement or mentoring, unless they have a management slot that they need to desperately fill, which, with the turn over rate, seems to be constant. Management in place is rude and disrespectful to the staff. 90% of the staff dislikes the way they are treated here.
Advice to Management: Change. Care. Your culture is cancerous. Have you not noticed how difficult it is to keep management and staff? Put District Managers in place that care for people, not ones that ignore you.

Title: "It was exciting"
Pros: The food was good. I liked it overall. My coworkers were great and the atmosphere was new for me. I enjoyed what i did and most of the customers.
Cons: They expected too much out of everyone and we weren't necessarily given the best discounts. I mean there were some but there wasn't much of a difference between our prices and the ones on the menus.

Title: "Awesome so far"
Pros: Good money and hours. Nice people
Cons: I have nothing bad yet

Title: "This place is so lame."
Pros: None. Why did I even start working here?
Cons: The management is sleeping with the hostesses, the kitchen staff are all on drugs, and everything you eat comes from a microwave.
Advice to Management: Corporate, just give up and hire robots. Your restaurant will run better.

Title: "food server at applbee's"
Pros: it's a good way to make ends meet, pay isn't bad, I make about $15/hr in tips during the busy times
Cons: high stress, dealing with people who can be rude and or demanding.
Advice to Management: streamline the ordering process.

Title: "Over worked, under paid"
Pros:
The kitchen staff was fun to work worth, most understood what they were doing
Worked with my college schedule
One of the managers was our age and was very good at his job
Time-off was reasonable
Cons:
Poor Management that couldn't get control of the store. They would play favorites a lot
Disparagement treatment
Control Issues
Advice to Management: Stop micromanaging and lying to people

Title: "Server"
Pros: I loved the family environment. My co-workers and managers were AMAZING! We had a really great time together.
Cons: The hours were horrible. We didn't close until 2am and I would not get home until 3 am.
Advice to Management: You're doing the best that you can but give the servers more that $2.13 and hour.

Title: "Promised the World . . ."
Pros: I was promised $100.00 a shift tips here in Glasgow, KY as well as the ability to pick and choose my hours.
Cons: Dishonesty with potential AND current employees. Poor management skills. No ability to schedule and changes in schedules random and nonsensical.
Advice to Management: Talk to the employees to discover how the management is lying to employees about potential opportunities within Applebees.

Title: "Fun, spontaneous, and sometimes overly demanding"
Pros:
*Managers are down-to-earth, and try to help in all departments if they can
*Tips (you get paid everyday)
*Flexible schedule, can usually work or get off by communicating with co-workers of the same position.
*Minimum wage is guaranteed if tips are unreliable during slow business
*Friendly customers and employees make your day brighter
*Good place to work for a sports enthusiast like myself
*Corporate often visits
Cons:
*Favoritism usually trends towards female employees and older indivuduals
*Hard to move up even if you are the best worker
*Clock-Out times are often unclear
*Lazy or MIA employees in any role slow down the entire business flow
*Ignorant customers make it hard to stay friendly
*Management lacks communication skills,
Advice to Management:
*Promote team cohesion by rallying your troops
*Lower unrealistic labor, gem, and sales expectations
*Communicate better with managers and staff
*Customers shouldn't be given free food for certain alcoholic beverages not being recommended to them as soon as they sit down. Alcohol is bad for your health.

Title: "going throurgh changes of company standards"
Pros: don't know if i have anything nice to say
Cons: quality of life is almost non existent with this company

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: fun and excited, you can boost your sales, get tips, plenty of teamwork
Cons: long hours, teamwork is on and off, management same way, it can be very stressful boring downtime
Advice to Management: upper mgt is doing well

Title: "It was one of the worst experiences of my life"
Pros: Get experience talking to new people. Sales experience isnt required but it is definitely nice to have. A lot of money is possible
Cons: have to deal with unruly customers. The managers would blame you if anything went wrong. "the custumer is always right" should be for the customer. Not the employer/

Title: "I was treated horribly, and often asked to work without clocking in."
Pros: The schedule worked with college.
Cons: Everything else - hours, pay, management.
Advice to Management: Treat your employees with respect before demanding it from them.

Title: "It was Alright"
Pros: Easy money, decent job, good management
Cons: Rude customers can ruin a whole day, bad tippers
Advice to Management: Be supportive of servers who have bad days

Title: "It was a decent part-time opportunity."
Pros: Flexible work schedule, co-workers and management.
Cons: late shifts, long standing hours, occasional rude and impatient customers.

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: It is what it is. Not bad for a college job.
Cons: I wouldn't make a career out of it. Inconsistent schedules, always being called in or let go early. You work alongside career waitresses who are overly dramatic and finicky.

Title: "room for advancement"
Pros: lots of potential for growth
Cons: some long hours, low tips
Advice to Management: don't over schedule and wear out employees

Title: "Good place to work while going to school."
Pros: I liked the people I worked with. Flexible schedule. I worked there from my senior year in high school through most of college.
Cons: Communication between managers was poor. Getting time off was often difficult.
Advice to Management: Communication between managers on a day to day basis needs to improve.

Title: "Began great, ended poorly"
Pros: When I first started my Applebee's was a company owned restuarant, Relationship with the staff, above average starting pay for the area
Cons: New owners making promises they did not keep, taking vacation away, lowering bonus dollars available to earn, closing continually, pay increases extremely low, low bonus potential for both restaurant managers and general managers, expecting too much from too few staff, inconsistency with direction, setting unrealistic profit and labor goals, lack of communication in my last store.
Advice to Management: Get in touch with not only your General Managers but your Assistant Managers as well. Take a look at setting realistic goals for profit and labor. Asking managers to run a kitchen alone in order to make a daily labor is not positive for the manager, the staff, or the guest. All suffer the effects of running low staff numbers to hit labor goals that are not realistic for the volume of the restaurant.

Title: "It pays the bills"
Pros: Always Busy so if you are good you can turn tables
Cons: Cheaper food so you bring in a different crowd

Title: "Pretty much like the movie "waiting" lacking the comedy"
Pros: Decent starting pay, lenient managers
Cons: Hours and pay raises were based on favortism. Managers didn't care about employees slacking off and pushing their work onto the few employees who actually put in effort.
Advice to Management: Work should be fun but not a complete joke. Don't laugh about someone being incompetent, fire them.

Title: "Long Hours - No Breaks"
Pros: Building relationships, working with some great people
Cons: Long hours, no breaks, lack of management support, constant changes, HUGE turnover

Title: "Great place to work!"
Pros: Upper management is great- owner Ed Doherty, Dave DiBartolo, Jim Pelliciari
Cons: I did not experience any cons
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you have always done

Title: "It's great fun place"
Pros: Great people, good food and good customers
Cons: Lousy hours, work during holidays.

Title: "Management transitions throughout my years serving"
Pros: Set corporate rules everyone needs to follow, fun atmosphere, strong brand awareness and informative training
Cons: Wage, overtime rules, new management that lacked a cohesive voice
Advice to Management: Remember to communicate the same ideas to employees by validating the general manager and shift manager's ideas and rules.

Title: "No structure, no leadership."
Pros: Discounted meals, flexible schedule, easy.
Cons: No opportunity to advance unless you want to serve for 5+ years, food is more than often wrong or cooked wrong, horrible pay, no breaks unless you're a smoker.
Advice to Management: You seek good servers, then hand them a script and hold them to it. Good servers have personality and don't need a script!

Title: "excellent"
Pros: great pay and staff and love it here
Cons: unpredictable salary and hours arent steady

Title: "Good Money, Poor Quality of Life"
Pros: Able to work harder for more money (profit sharing), able to meet new people easily and interact with different cultures regularly
Cons: Working 55+ hours week, salaried, with sometimes little to no sleep between 10+ hour shifts. Poor clientele can be difficult to deal with daily...
Advice to Management: Give 3 days off one week, 2 days off the next to help relieve the poor quality of life for managers.

Title: "Worked as a hostess for a year."
Pros: Easy to make lots of friends with coworkers.
Cons: Favoritism, very exhausting, THE WORST CLIENTS YOU CAN GET. Lousy tippers, no commission on huge parties of people anymore. Servers are severely underpaid for the amount of work they do. Management doesn't care for the employees at all. Servers get burned frequently and the entire staff is often very unhappy. Scheduling is a mess.
Advice to Management: Have more sympathy for the overworked staff! Stop playing favorites and express some gratitude for the work they do every now and then.

Title: "Fun yet tiring."
Pros:
Great work environment(Very diverse)
If you are a cook you are able to enjoy the perks of free food.
Good benefits but no dental.
Cons:
Long hours(like really long)
Hard to get a raise so make sure the pay you take is worth it.
Hard to grasp at first.
Advice to Management: Be sure to try and advance workers that are showing inniative

Title: "Poor Treatment"
Pros: Little experience is needed to start here
Cons: Lack of proper management, no support, terrible customer base.

Title: "Key Manager"
Pros: Meet and supervise a lot of nice people. You learn what you don't want out of a career. A lot of early morning downtime.
Cons: Underpaid for the amount of responsibility. Promotions from within are extremely rare and a tedious process. Upper management is unappreciative and have an unknown agenda. No clear concise business plans.
Advice to Management: Find another company.

Title: "One of the worst jobs I ever had."
Pros: It's an okay first job for a high school student to gain work experience in both the restaurant and customer service industries. You do usually have excellent support from the managers and co-workers once they get accustomed to you being on board though.
Cons: Definitely disgruntled employees and way too much added responsibility above and beyond the hostess position for the minimal pay. There are no buss boys-you're it and you have to maintain the restrooms and the front of house all at the same time so you're run ragged, covered in other people's used food from dirty dishes, you get disinfectant all over you from spraying the tables and you sweep the aisles during the shift as everyone's running around. You also frequently end up picking up the slack from your co-workers during busy times. Most employees there work well together and don't mind doing things that "aren't their jobs" to help everyone out, but the company could care less about compensating their employees who go above and beyond to earn them so much money.
Advice to Management: Give high performing employees better schedules, since that's the only perk managers could even offer.

Title: "Good place to gain some experience in order to get a job somewhere else"
Pros:
-No prior experience necessary
-Tips
-Flexible hours
Cons:
-Bad clientele
-Poor Management
-Pay attention to days and times available
Advice to Management: Find good quality managers and do what you can to keep them and/or promote from within.

Title: "Staffing & building maintenance are very below standard."
Pros: Name brand steakhouse with good reputation.
Cons: Staffing shortages. Management overload. Nepotism. No consistency of policy adherence. Rules and regulations are enforced by "whats-going-on-now" & "who is it".
Advice to Management: Have someone in HR complete an exit interview with the manager.. The person terminating is not the person that has an impartial opinion. Managing payroll by promoting from within is good but not at the expense of salaried managers losing their jobs. Average rates don't change but they can make total payroll cost by lowering the total payroll line.

Title: "Good at first"
Pros: Fun work environment before bought out.
Cons: Managers are alright, pay was bad

Title: "Nice environment"
Pros:
Mostly nice customers
Flexible schedule
Culture and environment are good
Cons:
Slow area for business
Only weekends are busy

Title: "Great Job while in college"
Pros: Flexible hours, great for those that need a part time job or in between jobs
Cons: Clientele isn't always the best, Corporate atmosphere...so very stringent

Title: "I hated working here."
Pros: for a college student with no experience, it was an easy jobe to get.
Cons: The Management communicaated poorly with each other and the employees. This usually resulted in cross communictions and two or more people doing the same thing twice or receiving conflicting instructions from several different people. Very innefficient and irritating.
Advice to Management: Get on the same page and sve yourself some time, money and turn-over. No one wants to work for a company that is such a mess.

Title: "Sever"
Pros: can really make good tips if you pick the right shifts
Cons:
people are unfriendly to work with
extensive menu knowledge

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good pay, some good managers
Cons: Some manager are plain disrespectful
Advice to Management: Get new managers who respect the workers

Title: "Lazy coworkers, entitled management, perverted customers"
Pros: There is always a steady flow of customers, you get to wear pretty much anything black
Cons: 2 for $20, the management team was a joke, they let customers and coworkers harass you, no one does their side work with out taking short cuts, dirty restaurant..the list goes on.
Advice to Management: Pay attention to your employees and address questions comments and concerns better

Title: "Pay was decent, environment sucks"
Pros: Got to meet a lot of people, pay was good
Cons: Work sucked, if someone was in a bad mood the whole crew was affected. LOTS of screaming in the kitchen.
Advice to Management: Pay servers minimum wage.

Title: "A great place to work - even for a chain restaurant."
Pros: Flexible hours. Amazing team atmosphere- I love the people I work with. Lots of earning potential. Great food discounts for employees. Each day is a different challenge.
Cons: The job can be physically demanding at high volume times. Besides the food discount, there are few employee incentives from the company.

Title: "Awful, awful place to work"
Pros: Shift meal. Decent pay for starting managers.
Cons:
The guests are terrible. Expect something for free every time. Mind you that Applebee's are often in Wal Mart parking lots, and attract the same kinds of people. It is the clientele they are shooting for.
If your Area Director doesn't like you, they will find any excuse whatsoever to fire you. It is a terrible atmosphere to work in. Highly stressful. No fun.
Advice to Management: Pay and benefits are the one reason anyone even works for this company. They have a horrible reputation for churning and burning managers.

Title: "A long road of ups and downs"
Pros: It works well if you are a college student. Flexible schedule. If you are a hard worker, they will give you the good shifts.
Cons: They have shifted over the last 10 years to caring a lot less about their employees. Used to give out employee recognition for certain years of service. Used to have a rewards catalogue that you could pick prizes from. Now they don't care about the employees. Morale has gone down the toilet. They got rid of the night cleaners and are now making the staff stay late to do it. Vacuuming, mopping, cleaning the windows.
Advice to Management: Treat your employees as if they were a 'second customer'. Applebee's used to be a restaurant that people wanted to work for.

Title: "good place to work"
Pros: hours a great have lots of good benefits and i get to spend alot of time with my family lots of persk to do htings you like
Cons: mnagement was great they do a wonderfull job up keeping people motivated and on task to creat the perfect atmosphere
Advice to Management: doing great job!

Title: "Applebee's is a decent job to have for college students or anyone transitioning."
Pros:
Large discount on food when you work a shift
Feel genuinely cared for by store management
Flexible schedule
Positive work environment
Cons:
Discount only for your self, on the days you work
Upward mobility is very slow/difficult to achieve
Tips are low and unreliable
Not enough employees; it is very hard getting shifts covered
Advice to Management: District management should put more effort towards understanding its employees and should participate (more hands-on) in team building/development.

Title: "its okay, being a server in general sucks!"
Pros: i recieve decent tips, nice people i work with, the managers are easy to work with, good exercise, a lot of fast walking
Cons: there are some rude guests, tipping out is a pain when you have to tip out the bartender even if they didnt make you any drinks.

Title: "ok"
Pros: money, nice place to work, work whenever i want
Cons: rude guests, poor management skills

Title: "Work where food, family and fun come together."
Pros: The guest and staff at Applebee's are always like greeting an old friend. Each time you enter, whether to dine, enjoy drinks at the bar, pick up a to go order or report to work, you are greeted with a warm, welcoming smile and a genuine appreciation of you being there.
Cons: Working late night hours can be difficult on family life. Being in the restaurant until the wee hours of the morning and trying to have a family does not offer a lot of work/life balance.
Advice to Management: Ensure a proper work/life balance for your management and staff.

Title: "overall the job is o.k. if you know your trade."
Pros: not being in one store all day
Cons: store level management are too green in most locations
Advice to Management: Training and working with employees

Title: "It was an okay job for while."
Pros: Most of the other employees were nice people.
Cons:
You'll get a lot of bad tippers at a restaurant like this. Also - didn't have automatic gratuity for large parties, so you could have a table of 8 people $150 total bill and get a $3 tip....
And, they're open late so you won't be home until 1:30 am on the weekends.
Advice to Management: Bring back automatic gratuity for large parties.

Title: "Maybe an Okay place to work"
Pros: The schedule was great for working after school. I would work after school and go right to work. Its not hard to serve and the tips can be very helpful for young people show need the money right away.
Cons: The schedule made it a little hard to study. I was a student at a community college when I worked at the applebees and sometimes I would leave the store late at night, like 3am in the morning to go to school the next day. on the weekend the hours can be a bit long also.

Title: "Horrible place to work."
Pros:
The free food during training.
It stayed pretty busy
Cons:
The DM was very unapproachable and would scream at you if you asked him for something. They expect you to plate, deliver, bus, and take all your orders. You are basically doing 3 people's jobs for one really low pay check.
The other waitresses didn't really want to help you, they rarely even talked to me.
The DM let me bury myself before changing his mind several times about what was my section and what was not.
Advice to Management: Always have your staff's back. If you see them struggling see why and what they can do to help.

Title: "It was enjoyable and i gained alot of experience"
Pros: Work well with managersand other emplyees.,
Cons: Scheduling and distance from my house
Advice to Management: They are very kind and professional

Title: "Does not treat employees with respect and consideration."
Pros: Only pros I can think of is that the ability to move up in the corporation is more likely to happen than most.
Cons: Food is less than appealing and difficult to push onto clientele. Corporate employees who come into stores are very inconsiderate and rude to employees, ability to communicate in a polite fashion is not there.
Advice to Management: Care a little bit more about the employees and attempt to communicate in a humane fashion.

Title: "Over worked and under paid"
Pros: The manager are pretty cool and its a fun job. The have awesome block parties depending on location.
Cons: The prices of entrees are so low... and the tips are even lower. Customers normally don't tip well unless you have regulars. The base pay for bartending is 3.00.
Advice to Management: Try not to over work your staff, and understand that they are paid from tips. If it is a slow night be understanding to others and cut the floor.

Title: "Good place to get your foot in the door of the service industry."
Pros: Flexible with scheduling, pays better than most jobs you can get without a degree (including tips), fun and relaxing atmosphere.
Cons: Servers are required to involve management to often, out dated/ non-user friendly computer system, strict corporate management, slow business at times.

Title: "Paid for College"
Pros: Control over your income, responsible for your guests, good support from management to get the job done.
Cons: There was lots of turnover in store management typically moving from store to store. Keep managers in their own stores. Each time a new manager arrives, they change formating especially in the bof and that lengthens ticket times and causes frustration for guests and foh staff
Advice to Management: Keep managers in the store for longer periods of time.

Title: "Working for them was a great experience"
Pros: Its fun and you make money
Cons: Your feet will hurt working hard
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work encourage your workers

Title: "Always had a great experience."
Pros: Benefits, always busy, consistent. I learned many of my core restaurant values with Applebees. I served as a corporate trainer, and still use what I learned in my later jobs.
Cons: Only had one minor issue with payroll, but it was fixed.

Title: "Overall good, but certainly some big drawbacks"
Pros: Aggressive advertising, promotions that drive traffic, good happy hour pricing-all things that keep guests coming to the store to help build sales. Leadership is solid for the most part.
Cons: Late night hours are too late for certain nights of the week. Too much emphasis placed on Guest survey scores, to the point you feel pressured to influence the guest to fill one out on their phone in the store.
Advice to Management: Cut the late night hours back.

Title: "I love working with customers."
Pros: Working in a fast pace environment every day, not knowing what was going to happen was good for me with the change of scenery.
Cons: Having not so understanding customers.
Advice to Management: n/a

Title: "Pretty terrible"
Pros: Tips, wannabe friendly associates, casual atmosphere, food discount..... I'm having trouble thinking of pros to be honest!
Cons: Barely make any money for a lot of hard work, favoritism by management, negative energy between associates
Advice to Management: Get it together!! You are so disorganized!

Title: "Not a bad gig"
Pros: It was easy. Microwaving never felt so good. Manager was nice and allowed time off if we needed it.
Cons: Food. It was not that great and we were limited by what we could try to do to make it better.

Title: "Okay job if you are looking to get some extra money...but as far as paying your bills waiting tables here won't cut it"
Pros: Flexible scheduling, easy to learn
Cons: Poor working environment, people play around too much
Advice to Management: Structure would be nice

Title: "I didn't like any of the people I worked with, especially the management."
Pros: Better to have a job than no job....? I guess...?
Cons: people suck, managers talk down to you, kitchen wasn't cleaned properly, management screws up the schedule every week, clientele sucks
Advice to Management: Try and actually have a little bit of compassion for your employees. There was an ice storm and it was extremely dangerous to drive yet they made all of us come in and made no effort to help or pick anybody up. I drove my little beemer and ended up sliding on black ice in a ditch. They ended up firing me because "I didn't show up." Seriously?

Title: "Overall my experience was great. I learned a lot about business and also met some great people."
Pros: You will meet great people and learn a lot. After leaving Applebee's I felt like I could go anywhere to work and be productive.
Cons: The "customer is always right" approach even when the customer is wrong. Having low customer complaints is important but basically giving away free business/service to satisfy them shouldn't always be the solution.
Advice to Management: Don't be to hard/rough on employees. Happy employees lead to a more positive and productive business.

Title: "Unprofessional"
Pros: It is a good place to turn over tables quickly on a good day. Most of the time, coworkers are very friendly and everyone tends to help each other out.
Cons: Management lacks in good work ethic and overall the company is cheap with hiring workers. They pay little and demand employees to do the job of at least 2 people each, emphasis on 'at least'. Most of the time, managers hired have little to no backbone and will not defend employees against rude customers but instead issue a write up for the bad experience. Aside that, it is questionable if any of the managers that have passed through this company even have any solid experience.
Advice to Management: Learn to manage such an easy restaurant.

Title: "Doesn't care about the staff"
Pros: At least you have a job (the only thing that keeps me from going crazy while there)
Cons: the clientele believes that 10% tips is doing something or better yet the young teenagers that don't tip at all; $3.50 meal comps that can only be used on certain items (i've never worked at a job that didnt give their hourly employees at least 50% off meals); lack of hours; 3% tip out; managers that are afraid to go to customers when they are upset; no organization; managers only focused on their bonuses and not the well being of their staff
Advice to Management: If you treat your hourly staff like crap, you will only lose in the long run.

Title: "Great college positon"
Pros: the amount of money made
Cons: long hours and rude people

Title: "ok for a starter serving job"
Pros: flexible schedule, fun, usually fun management
Cons: depends on the manager, will give you everyday to work if you are willing to

Title: "good place to grow but get out fast"
Pros: room for learning for new servers
Cons: mismanagement, nepotism, favoritism, multiple HR issues

Title: "Not The Best Experience"
Pros: Nothing For A Waiter Honestly
Cons: Must Pay For Every Last Meal You Eat Out Of Pocket!!! A French Fry Fell Off A Tray Into My Hand One Time While I Was Preparing A Plate In The Back...I Ate The 1 Fry That Fell Into My Hand (Because I Didn't Want To Put It On A Persons Plate After It Reached My Palm) And The Manager Made Me Stop Chewing And Physically Spit The Fry Out Into A Tray She Put In Front Of My Face...Nonsense
Advice to Management: Try To Offer More To A Person Working For 4.50 An Hour In A Middle class establishment with supervisors creating a high pressure environment

Title: "Review"
Pros: Great place to work. Good team environment and advancement possibilities. Extensive training program.
